paper.title: Incremental learning and forgetting in RBF networks and SVMs with applications to financial problems
paper.abstract: Radial Basis Function Networks (RBFNs) have been widely applied to practical classification problems. In recent years, Support Vector Machines (SVMs) are gaining much popularity as promising methods for classification problems. This paper compares those two methods in view of incremental learning and forgetting. The authors have reported that the incremental learning and active forgetting in RBFNs provide a good performance for classification under the changeable environment. First in this paper, a method for incremental learning and forgetting in SVMs is proposed. Next, a comparative simulation for a portfolio problems between RBFNs and SVMs will be made.

domain_result.justification: 论文摘要中提到，作者将对RBFNs和SVMs在投资组合问题（portfolio problems）上进行比较模拟，这表明论文的核心技术应用于投资组合管理领域。
